TestCase.TestCaseTitle: Create a Hostile Event initiated by an Organisation.
TestCase.TestCaseObjective: BSO validation. Test whether the Producer/Provider is able to create the HostilityStatusCode of an Event (ArtilleryFire for instance), referencing the Organisation that initiated it, and the Consumers/Receivers are able to understand (and display) it correctly.
TestCase.TestCaseScenario: The Producer creates an Event (ArtilleryFire) with Hostile HostilityStatusCode.The only way to reference the (enemy) Organisation that initiated it, within MIP4.0 is by describing it in the DescriptionText Element.The Consumers receive the information and interpret it correctly.
TestCase.TestCaseEnvironment: Internet or Co-located. Exchange Pattern: R/R, P/S.
TestCase.TestCasePreCondition: The Producer/Provider has created a topic which includes message elements belonging to the Event message schema area. The Consumers have subscribed to this topic.
TestCase.TestCaseInput: Any MIP4SLT3IS test case where a hostile Organisation is informed.
TestCase.TestCaseConclusion: This test is considered a success if the Hostile Event is processed and interpreted correctly on all Nations' C2IS.

TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepAction:
The Producer (1) creates an Event (ArtilleryFire) with name XXX_HEAF_5911 and with the following status information: * HostilityStatus=Hostile * DescriptionText="initiated by 666 (PRK) FA Bn" (Example)
Notices: XXX in name of the object is meant (in principle) to be replaced by the 3 letter code of the country name. Example for the name of the Event: PRK_ HEAF_5911.
TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepResult: Consumers (2) receive and display the Bombing correctly.
